learning_obj.text: Understand the five phases of DMEDI and how they build on one another.
Translate stakeholder needs into measurable requirements.
Use data to explore and evaluate design alternatives.
Develop and pilot a new process or service that meets defined quality and performance standards.
Integrate DMEDI thinking into program design and innovation projects.

characteristics.text: The DMEDI tool is a Six Sigma framework used to design or create new processes, products, or services that meet customer or stakeholder needs right from the start.
It stands for Define, Measure, Explore, Develop, and Implement.

process.text: Define customer/stakeholder needs and project goals.

sub_bullets.text: Create a problem statement and project charter.

process.text: Collect data to understand requirements and baseline conditions.
Translate customer needs into measurable specifications (Critical to quality factors).

sub_bullets.text: Brainstorm and analyze multiple design alternatives.
Use tools like process mapping, cause and effect analysis, or benchmarking to compare options.
Narrow down to the best possible solutions using data.
Build and test prototypes, mock-ups, or pilot projects.
Use feedback loops to refine designs before scaling.
Finalize and launch the new design or process.
Set up monitoring and control plans to ensure sustainability.

benefits.text: Structured innovation: provides a clear roadmap for creating new solutions.
Customer-focused: Ensures outcomes align with real needs.
Data-driven: Decisions are based on evidence, not assumptions.
Risk reduction: Problems are identified early.
Scalability: Creates solutions that can be replicated and sustained.
Encourages input from multiple disciplines for stronger results.
Worthwhile development strengthens DMEDI by keeping each step focusing on improvements that deliver meaningful, lasting value.

example.text: Improve response time, and measure current average = 24 hours.
Explore causes: backlog, no templates, staffing gaps.
Develop workflow, templates, and auto-routing system.
Implement rollout and reduce response time to 4 hours.

evaluation.text: Pre- and post-training quizzes to assess conceptual understanding of DMEDI phases.
Hands-on project exercise: Participants complete a small DMEDI project.

sub_bullets.text: Example: designing a new data collection process or workflow.
